dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN FOREMAN, age 51, gets out of bed. His wife Ann, 46, mumbles, doesn’t open her eyes. EXT. DAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT A light goes on in a window. INT. DAN’S BATHROOM - EARLY MORNING - NIGHT Dan shaves, showers, it’s still dark outside. He looks at the grey in his hair. INT. DAN’S BEDROOM ~ EARLY MORNING - NIGHT Dan gets dressed in the dark. Puts on his tie. Kisses Ann on the forehead. Behind Ann is a picture of Dan‘s family. Dan tiptoes out. INT. DAN’'S KITCHEN - EARLY MORNING - NIGHT Dan drinks coffee. On a small TV behind him, a business channel is on. We see anti-WTO riots. Bill Gates. Images computer chips being manufactured in India. Dan turns the SOUND UP as a new story comes on, the GLOBECOM logo with MERGER RUMORS as a headline.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: After months of speculation, analysts expect an announcement this week that Globecom International will acquire Waterman Publishing and its flagship magazine, Sports America. Dan’s attention is caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man at the helm of Globecom, billionaire media magnate Teddy K, has been on a spending spree recently -- acquiring a food service company, a cable operator, and two telecommunications providers in deals totaling more than 13 billion dollars. (pause) And, how did one lucky ferret owner come to own the largest dog-treat manufacturer on the east coast? Dan turns off the TV. He dumps the used coffee grains in trash, where he sees the box for...a “Home Pregnancy Test Kit”. He lifts it out of the garbage. Glances over at a picture of his daughter Alex in tennis gear on the fridge Fear washes over his face. Lights sweep over the window. A car horn BEEPS. Dan looks at his watch. EXT. DAN‘’S HOUSE, SUBURBS ~ EARLY MORNING - NIGHT Dan gets in a cab. EXT. AIRPORT —- MORNING A plane takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan gets out of a rental car. INT. KALB’S OFFICE - DAY EUGENE KALB is sixty-something, the CEO of Kalb Automotiv He shakes hands with Dan.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: Thanks for the Lakers tickets. The seats were great, and I’m sick of my damn luxury box.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I hope Taylor had a fun birthday party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) My grandson had a terrific time. But I still don‘t want to advertise in the magazine. My son-in-law tells me people don’t read anymore. Too much effort moving the eyes back and forth. We're putting our budget into TV, radio and internet. A pause. We’re ready for Dan to launch into a big pitch.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: “Okay?” What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I‘m not going to try to sell you.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: Why the hell not? You're a salesman, aren‘t you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yes. I’m just not a very good one.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: I‘1l say.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (laughs) But I am going to ask you one favor. Dan takes an issue of SPORTS AMERICA magazine out of his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm going to leave you an issue of the magazine. And I'll personally send you a new one every week. I‘ll call you again in a few weeks, and if you want to, we'll talk. There’s a pretty good article comparing today’s quarterbacks with Jonny Unitas.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: There’s no comparison. Unitas would kick their butts. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KALB (cont'd) (holds up magazine) So this is your sales pitch?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've worked at the Magazine for over twenty years, and I believe in it.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: Good for you. You worried about all these rumors that your parent company's gonna be sold?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not really. Can't see how it would affect me.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: Well, hopefully it won't. {gets up) You know, that Teddy K. character offered to buy my business a few years ago. Wanted to merge us with Pep Boys. I told him to screw himself...who knows, Maybe I was dumb. My son-in-law says I'ma dinosaur.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t knock the dinosaurs. They ruled the earth for millions of years. They must have been doing something right. Kalb laughs. The two of them shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP ON a DINOSAUR, or, more accurately, a cell-phone shaped like a dinosaur, held by CARTER DURYEA, 26, executive.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We will never be able to reach this significant, untapped market unless we learn to think like them. In point of fact, less than .05 percent of all cell phone users are currently beneath the age of five years old. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a young  CARTER (cont'd) The Triceratops phone, the T-Rex phone, and the Pterodactyl phone are going to change all that. And...each phone will have its own unique ring. The cell phone ROARS like a dinosaur.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (little kid voice) Mommy...I want one...buy me one for Christmas... At the end of the conference table sits STECKLE, the boss this group of young marketing execs.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: P.F.G., Carter. P.F.G.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG EXEC
dialogues.text: (whispers to Carter) What's P.F.G?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Pretty frigging good. Carter makes the phone ROAR again. Steckle looks up from checking the email on his handheld blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, ladies, I have an announcement to make. It’s on. Teddy K. has busted his move, and we are taking over Waterman Publishing. The room ERUPTS IN APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: The man has vision. He’s a maniac. And I guess it’s okay for me to tell you, Teddy K has personally asked me to go over there and turn around marketing in the magazine division. So, if you'll excuse me. Carry on. Steckle gets up and leaves the meeting. Everyone starts talking.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG EXEC
dialogues.text: (excited, to Carter) Waterman Publishing -- wow --  6. CARTER a Yeah, yeah, yeah —- Carter hurries out the door. INT. GLOBECOM HALLWAY — DAY Carter follows Steckle down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Mark! Mark! He catches up with him, dodging past other people in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Okay, so you're taking me with you. You have to take me with you.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Carter, I'm gonna take that place and whip its fat ass into shape... And...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: And? : ~

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: And I want you to come run ad sales at Sports America.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: The magazine's a cash cow. It's the cornerstone. I mentioned your name to Teddy K. He liked what you did with cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wait, hold up. Teddy K. knows my name?

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: I’m going to tell you something and i don’t want it to go to your head. (pause) You‘re being groomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m being groomed? (pause) Mark, thank you. I am going to kick so much ass for you. I will take no prisoners. I will be your ninja assassin!

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: (cheerful) Wow, you're the new me! (beat, dead serious) No. I’m the new me. (smiles) Congratulations! Steckle walks off. Carter gives a KARATE KICK. INT. ALEX’S BEDROOM - NIGHT ALEX, Dan’s 18 year old daughter, lies in bed, awake. She has a tennis ball in her hand. She tosses it up in the ai catches it with the same hand, repeating the motion over over. EXT. DAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT A cab pulls up, drops Dan off. INT. DAN‘S KITCHEN - NIGHT Going through the kitchen. Dan pauses, looks into the wastebasket. The pregnancy kit is gone. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, CORRIDOR - NIGHT Dan goes down the hall, opens a door, looks into his 16 y old daughter JANA's room. She’s sleeping. He closes the door again. Continues down the hall, takes a deep breath, and leoks in on Alex's room. INT. ALEX’S BEDROOM - NIGHT ALEX looks up from her bed.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad.  8. DAN wot! Hey, button. What are you doing awake?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Couldn't sleep,

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Couldn’t sleep? Why? You worrying about something?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Cause if you are worried about something...you know you can always talk to me. Remember, when you were little, we made a deal, we'd always be honest with each other.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yeah...I actually am a little tired. We’re still Playing tomorrow, right? —_

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Alright, I’1l see you then. (turns off the light) Love you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (stands there a moment) Love you too. He closes the door, heading to his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan‘s wife ANN, 46, looks up as Dan changes out of his tr clothes.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: What time is it? Hi, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little after three. Sorry I woke you up. Go back to sleep. Dan gets in bed beside her. He kisses her shoulder. She kisses him back.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: You're not tired?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not really....Honey, does umm...does Alex have a new boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Uh, no, not that I know of. Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Well...no reason. What about that Myron kid?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: (kisses him) I think they’re just friends. (pause) I‘m pregnant --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What?! (pause) I'm sorry, I thought you said you were pregnant. (she nods) You can’t be pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I know, but I am.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: But -- How did that happen?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Well, I think you were there too.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No, honey. You’re done with all that.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: That's what Dr. Steinberg said, but...I guess he was wrong.  10.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Are you sure? (she nods) Holy crap...holy crap! Does it feel like a boy?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Right now it feels like a stomach flu.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You can't be serious. Are you serious? (beat) Alright...alright. This is going to be fine. When he's twenty-one, I’ll be...seventy-two.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Holy crap. Dan lays back in bed, staring anxiously up at the ceiling

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I am so excited. Carter is lying in bed with his (newlywed) wife Kimberly. He's on his back. She’s facing away from him.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I am just so damn excited. Is this excitement contagious, or what?

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m being groomed. I am being groomed. Do you understand what that means?  il.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: That you‘re a chimpanzee?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It means...well, it means we’re on the road. It’s all falling into place. We can get a bigger house. We can have kids. I mean, we have a life going on here!

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Carter, it’s three AM. How much more enthusiasm are we looking at here? Fifteen minutes? An hour?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I’m sorry, it’s just...Teddy K. knows my name.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Are you even qualified for this job?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What? Sure. Selling cell phones, selling ad space, it’s all the same crap. Anyway, it’s just a stepping stone. EXT. CARTER’S HOUSE - NIGHT The lone light goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU. on computer monitor (spatially same as house) showing of GlobeCom's takeover of Waterman Publishing. PULL OUT t reveal everyone freaking out in office. MORTY, middle age dapper, and morbid, is saying to anyone who will listen ( the moment, THEO, another salesman):

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: We're all going to get fired.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Anything's possible.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: It's not possible, it’s probable.  12. LOUIE, barrel chested, frenetic, comes down the hall with ALICIA, a sales woman.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: Have you heard about this Teddy K guy?

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Everyone’s heard of him --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: I hear he’s an albino, but he covers it up with makeup!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Hey, Alicia! Alicia? Are you fired yet?

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: What? No! Why, are you fired? INT. DAN’S OFFICE - DAY A placard on the desk reads DAN FOREMAN -- VP AD SALES. D office has a great view of the city. It’s decorated with memorabilia from Dan’s more than twenty years at Sports America. Dan sits with his boss, ENRIQUE.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I‘m sorry, are you -- are you saying I’m fired?

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: Not yet, not yet, Dan. But I can’t predict the future. The thing is, you‘re not head of ad sales anymore. Carter Duryea is.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Who the hell is Carter Duryea?

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: Some hotshot from GlobeCom. This is a bummer, Dan. A real bummer. But you’re lucky. A lot of people are getting canned immediately, across the company.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Are you getting fired?  13.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: Me? No.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We had our biggest year ever this year. My team works incredibly hard. I'm not going to put up with this.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: You have to put up with it. I mean, what are you gonna do, start somewhere new? You're not a kid anymore. You know how tough it is out there. Places are cutting back, they’re not looking for guys like you who make a decent salary. Hey, I’m as pissed off about this as you are.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: So then why are you smiling?

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: I'm not smiling.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Your lips are curling up.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: They do that naturally, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan’s older daughter, Alex, walks into the Waterman Publishing building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex gets into an elevator. She's holding a tennis racket Behind her, Carter HURRIES towards the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hold up! Please. Alex uses her racket to hold the door open.  14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Alex are alone in the elevator. Alex pushes th button for the 47th floor.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: 47. Going to the Sports America offices?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: +.-What are you, an intern?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No. My Dad works there...Are you interning there?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I'm starting a new job there.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh. Cool. Congratulations. That’s awesome.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thank you. (pause) To be honest, I’m scared shitless. I have no idea what I'm doing. Alex laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Don’t tell anyone, okay?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (laughs) Okay. I won't. She smiles at him. He smiles back. The elevator reaches t floor, the door opens, and Carter's expression turns to o of confidence.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: After you. INT. SPORTS AMERICA OFFICE, BY DAN’S OFFICE - DAY Theo, a salesman, passes by Dan.  15.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Dan, your daughter’s here.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: She is? Dan starts down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Hey, Boss, what’s this takeover gonna mean for our stock options?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I have no idea. And don’t call me “Boss”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the other direction comes Carter, led by DEBRA, the receptionist.

dialogues.speaker: DEBRA
dialogues.text: (kissing ass) So nice to meet you, Mr. Colon‘’s very excited to work with you -- As Dan passes Morty’s office, Morty yells to Dan.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Dan, you hear anything new? Are we all fired?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (distracted) Can’t talk now, Morty -- His head turned towards Morty, DAN WALKS RIGHT INTO CARTE It's a real COLLISION. Debra gives a GASP.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, I’m sorry. You alright?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm fine. It was my fault. You okay?  16.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I think so. No broken bones.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Alright, then. No harm, no foul. Dan moves on towards the reception area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan walks up to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey, champ. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Umm, tennis, remember?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is today no good for you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (beat) No, it’s fine. Heck with it. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Alex are playing tennis on a rooftop court. Alex SERVES. Dan gets a racket on it, but just barely. The bal goes FLYING. In fact, she is an awesome tennis player, running Dan rag around the court. Dan tries to reach a crosscourt shot an tumbles to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You okay? Dan looks over at his daughter, and dees some PUSHUPS. AFTER their match, they sit on a bench. Dan is drenched.  17.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You sort of sucked today.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I was holding back, to build up your confidence.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah right. You're gettin’ old.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dad, remember how I was saying maybe I’d want to transfer to NYU? Well...I got in.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: To NYU? Sweetheart, that’s fantastic! (beat) But that means...you'd have to live in the city.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah...I want to study creative writing, and NYU has a great program.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How about the tennis team?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dad...I’m not going to be a professional tennis player.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Well look, button, it’s almost as tough being a writer. Living in the city, I don’t think it’s such a great idea. It can be really lonely, you need street smarts. I just don’t think it’s a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: But I want to try living in the city. I know NYU’s a lot more expensive. But it would be such a good experience.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. It is more expensive, but... (pause) It’s your education, that’s the most important thing...We can Manage it. She hugs him, elated. Over Alex’s shoulder, Dan’s face falls, the pressure getting the best of him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yech, you're like drenched. When Alex pulls back, he smiles for her sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enrique is going down the hall, showing Carter around.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: This is Morty Wexler. Morty, Carter Duryea.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You're on the Ford account, right?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Great to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: You too. I'm really looking forward to working with you! Enrique and Carter move on. Louie comes out of his office

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: (in a mincing voice, imitating Morty) “I'm really looking forward to working with you.” Louie makes an “ass-kissing” sound.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Bite me. Further down the hall, Enrique leads Carter towards DAN’S OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: We have a terrific office for you, great view. But it’s not cleared out yet. Enrique takes Carter into DAN’S OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: Not bad, hunh? Excuse me a second, I’m just going to use the little boy‘s room. Enrique leaves Carter in Dan’s comfortable office. Carter looks at the view.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (impressed) Tasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan comes back into the office, showered and clean after game. INT. DAN’S OFFICE - DAY Carter is still waiting for Enrique. He is glancing at Da FAMILY PHOTOS, as well as photos of Dan with sports stars etc. when Dan comes in.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh! Sorry, this is your office.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) You‘re the guy I bumped into.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yes. You must be Dan Foreman. (smiles) Hi, I’m Carter Duryea.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You're Carter Duryea?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yes. Great to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Carter Duryea who's coming in to run ad sales?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Correct. Carter puts his hand out.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Me? I’m twenty-six.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You’re twenty-six... Dan shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: ++-and you're my new boss.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I guess so... (wincing) Hey, that’s some...Kung-Fu Grip you've got there. Dan lets go of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: So what kind of experience do you have in ad sales?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Not much.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: None, Well, that’s not much.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I'm a fast learner. So now you know how old I am. How old are you? 20.  21.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’m fifty-one.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wow, that’s -- that’s crazy. You're one year older than my father. Enrique comes in.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: Great, you two have met!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, we’re good pals already. (smiles) Well, nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Un-hunh. It was a pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: Dan, you want this door closed?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, why don’t you go ahead and close it. They exit, Enrique closing the deor behind them. Dan picks up an AUTOGRAPHED BASEBALL. Across the room is a silver trophy-plate reading "1987 — SALESMAN OF THE YEAR”. He takes aim, and WHIPS THE BALL AT THE PLATE, SENDING IT FLYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plate reading DAN FOREMAN, VICE PRESIDENT AD SALES is s out of its holder as MOVING MEN transfer Dan’s stuff to a smaller office. Dan steps into his new office, watching t boxes pile up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks with a well-dressed man, an uncle, perhaps? man looks proud of him.  22.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It was pretty unexpected. It’s like a pretty big promotion.

dialogues.speaker: PORSCHE DEALER
dialogues.text: Wow! That's fantastic! Way to go. The camera reveals that he is in a Porsche dealership. Th man accompanying him is a salesman.

dialogues.speaker: PORSCHE DEALER
dialogues.text: (stops in front of a car) So, the Boxster S-type has more guts. You’ll sure feel the extra horsepower. But if you really want to go, I’d say take the Nine Eleven Carrerra.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (considers) T‘ll take the Nine Eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter tries out the stereo. The cup holders. The seat warmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter ZOOMS out of the lot in a new, black Porsche Carre INT. PORSCHE 911 — DAY

dialogues.speaker: NICE
dialogues.text: Carter is checking himself out in the mirror, distracted, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An SUV SLAMS into the front of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AIRBAG SLAMS Carter back into his seat.  23.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Mmmff --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche sits there, its front left side CRUMPLED. The suv driver puts down his cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: SUV DRIVER
dialogues.text: I'll call you back. (calls out) Jackass! EXT. CARTER’S HOUSE - NIGHT The damaged Porsche pulls up into Carter‘s driveway. Cart gets out, his arm in a sling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks in, noticing a couple of SUITCASES by the do Kimberly is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hi. I uh...I hurt my arm. But I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: I’m glad you‘re okay. Carter... She nods to the suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Kim...Kimmy...Again? Come on. Seven months. We've been married seven months. I know things have been a bit off. I’ve been putting in crazy hours at my job. I know we should have -- we should have gone on a real honeymoon, that was my fault. I should have -- TI should have shut off that cell phone -- that thing was ringing off the hook! The good thing is, I can change. This has been a great lesson to me. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t try to sell me, Carter.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (plowing on) Kim, I love you. I want to have children with you.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: But I don’t want to have children with you. I don’t even know if I want to have children, period. I told you that. I told you on our second date.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I thought you were joking.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Carter...is this really such a surprise to you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ---Are you...sleeping with someone else?

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: ++-I was. But I broke up with him. Carter bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wow, that must have been rough on him! She goes and picks up her bags.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: I'll be at my parents. They're really excited to have me back. Carter covers his face. We hear a HEARTBEAT. INT. OBSTETRICIAN‘S OFFICE — DAY 24. Dan stares nervously at Ann as the obstetrician listens f the baby’s heartbeat with a “stereo” stethoscope.

dialogues.speaker: OBSTETRICIAN
dialogues.text: We're gonna hear two heartbeats now, that strong slower one is yours, mom.  25. Dan listens as A STRONG, STEADY HEARTBEAT is heard over t scope’s amplifier. The obstetrician fishes around. A QUIETER, FASTER HEARTBEAT is heard beside the bass drum Ann's pulse.

dialogues.speaker: OBSTETRICIAN
dialogues.text: And that...that’s your baby’s heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Oh my God... Ann smiles, looking up at Dan, who is looking pale.

dialogues.speaker: OBSTETRICIAN
dialogues.text: Nice strong heartbeat. That’s your new baby, Dan. Dan looks stressed out. Subjectively, with Dan, we hear a IRREGULAR beat joining the other beats. He tries to smile grimacing instead.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Dan?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah...that's...fantastic...I’m -- I just feel a little -- you know -- CUT TO: Dan‘s shirt is open, and the doctor is listening DAN‘S HEARTBEAT.

dialogues.speaker: OBSTETRICIAN
dialogues.text: Well, you are having a little bit of arrhythmia. Have you been drinking a lot of caffeine? Are you under a lot of stress?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Well...I did sort of get demoted at work.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: {nods, tries to smile) We'll talk. Ann looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU McDonalds wrapper on the passenger seat. Carter sits alone in his Porsche outside his house. He reclines the car seat as far back as it will go (which isn’t far). He curls up to try to sleep in the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Grande cup of STARBUCKS coffee is drained by Carter. Carter's assistant, SAMMY, comes up to him holding a new

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Another?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, don’t even ask, just keep it coming. Carter starts on the next cappuccino as he goes to the he ef a long conference table. The entire sales team, as wel as everyone's secretaries, and even a couple of the janitorial staff, are gathered. Dan sits among the rest o the sales team.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: How was everyone's weekend? Good? {puts his face in his hand) I'm sorry, that was... An uncomfortable pause, as Carter gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: All right! I'd like to thank everyone for joining me. As most of you know, my name’s Carter Duryea and I am really excited to be working with such a great group of people. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER (cont'd) Like Teddy K. says, what makes Globecom great...is the men and women...of Globecom -- is it like a thousand degrees in here, or is it me? (beat) It’s me. Morty looks at Dan, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Now I’ve been given an agenda here, and you’re gonna learn this about me, I’m a machine... (Carter blanks) What was I saying?

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: An agenda?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Agenda, yes. In order to achieve the goals that have been set out for us, we are going to have to increase ad pages by 20 percent. There is a MURMUR in the room. Carter sucks down some mor coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (whispers. to Louie) Shit, I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: {with disbelief) Twenty percent? Carter, only a start up magazine can do that.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Well I think this team can do it.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (tentative) Uh. . «How?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (automatic) Well, Morty --

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) Good question. And the answer... (an epiphany) »-.is synergy. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. 28. CARTER (cont'd) To take it to the next level, we need to team up, we need to synchronize, we need to synergize! We're not alone here. We're not alone! We are now part of one of the biggest multimedia and brand hame companies in the universe. Let’s take advantage of that. Did you know that one of our sister companies makes Krispity Krunch?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So we talk to our brothers and sisters at Krispity Krunch, and we make a deal to supply Sports Factoids for their boxes, so when Joe Couch Potato is snacking, what does he see? Sports America Krispity Krunch Sports Factoids! He's definitely getting more Krispity Krunch, and he’s definitely not getting Krunch ‘n‘ Krackle, which looks and tastes exactly the same, but has no sports Factoids. Krispity Krunch is so pleased with the idea that they guarantee twenty-six pages a year. Besides which, they know Teddy kK. Is gonna be pissed if they don’t pony up. Bingo -- synergy!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Isn‘t that cheating?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hell no! And you know what else? We also own Starline Cell Phones. What do we put on their browser?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Factoids?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yes! Factoids! Synergy! You know what else? Box scores! And ads! We make a deal where one-hundred thousand hits on the internet has an equivalent value of one ad page in our hard copy. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER (cont'd) Are you getting it, people? The Magazine is now just a sort of portal to a synergized world of cross-promotion! Let’s open things wide here, people! Let’s get psyched! Come on, let’s take the plunge, let’s embrace something new! (pointing) Louie, are you psyched about this?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: ++»I’m psyched.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Okay. Alicia, are you psyched?

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You...what’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: MAINTENANCE GUY
dialogues.text: Hector. I’m in maintenance.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh. That’s cool. Hector, I know you‘re psyched.

dialogues.speaker: MAINTENANCE GUY
dialogues.text: I’M PSYCHED!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Alright, Hector’s psyched! And if Hector'’s psyched, then I‘m psyched! I am psyched for this team! Who else is psyched! People call out “I’m psyched!”

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (leans over to Louie) Who do you think will be the first to get canned?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: (whispers ) My bet’s on Dan. He’s prehistoric.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Dan sit at a sushi restaurant. Carter’s LEG BOUNCES with nervous energy.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m glad you could join me for lunch, Dan. Do you like sushi?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'll stick with the teriyaki.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You should try some! The spicy tuna roll is awesome here. Here, try it! Carter holds out his plate, which is covered with sushi.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Get that. Get that. Go fishin’ man. Dan looks at it a moment, then takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (hates it) Mmm ~- yeah. Really...raw.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (talks over him) So I wanted to talk to you, because the increase in ad pages is only part of the equation in terms of achieving the bottom line my bosses want me to hit. I'm also going to have to get rid of 300 K salary from the sales team, immediately.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Carter, I don’t make that much money.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I know what you make, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Alright. Well. (gets up) I wish you told me I was fired before I ate the goddam fish.  31.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hey, hold on a second, I’m not letting you go here.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You're not?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No. Look, you're an excellent salesman, you ran a good team, and I think there’s the potential for you to be an awesome wing man.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: An awesome wing man. Well, Carter, I can see the benefit to you in having an awesome wing man. But what's the benefit to me, at this point in my career, in being an awesome wing man?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Well, one benefit, at this point in your career, is you get to keep your job. That‘s a pretty good benefit, don’t you think? Dan stands there, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The salesman are hushed, as SWEARING is heard from down t hall, behind the closed door of Carter’s (Dan’s old) offi

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you smiling? You're smiling at me -- you think this is funny! Enrique emerges from Carter's office.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: That A-HOLE. We'll see how soon this place goes down the SHITTER without me! That LITTLE, SNOT-

dialogues.speaker: NOSED BRAT
dialogues.text: Enrigue STORMS past where Morty and Dan are drinking coff Morty raises his eyebrows at Dan.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Maybe there is justice in the world.  32. Enrique pushes past a group of eavesdropping salespeople his way to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: ENRIQUE
dialogues.text: You enjoying yourselves? Great. As Enrique leaves, Alicia and Theo do a little high-five. INT. CARTER‘S (DAN’S OLD) OFFICE - DAY Having just fired Enrique, Carter sags, leaning his head against the closed door. MUSIC RISES over the following montage. INT. DAN’S NEW OFFICE - DAY Dan puts a copy of the magazine into a Fedex packet to se to EUGENE KALB in Los Angeles, Sammy, Carter’s twenty-something assistant, appears at hi door.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: (snappy) Carter's ready for you. INT. CARTER‘S (DAN’S OLD) OFFICE ~ DAY The office is empty and stark, absent the clutter of Dan’ pictures and memorabilia. Carter hands Dan a booklet of forms in the Globecom blue color.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Dan, I'd like you to fill this out, please -- Carter sees Dan glance at the lone photo on his shelf -- picture of Kimberly. Carter turns the picture over on it’ face.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It’s a 360 evaluation.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: And that is?  33.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It’s a self-evaluation. They call it 360 because it’s supposed to be from every angle. It’s corporate policy. It‘d be great if you have it on Monday. Carter pats Dan on the arm, dismissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter addresses a group of buyers, Dan at his side.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: If you want to get aggressive, if you want to reach that core demographic --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I believe --

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) Not now, Dan. (to buyers) Sports America is the top magazine, boys twelve to eighteen, in the country. Dan deflates a little. INT. CARTER'S (DAN’S OLD) OFFICE ~ NIGHT Late at night. A janitor goes by as Carter works late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP PROFILE Carter runs against a jungle background. a moment it looks as if he’s out in the wild. He has a ph to his ear. KIM’S VOICE (0.S.) Hi, leave me a message! Or don’t. BEEP. We PULL BACK, revealing Carter is jogging on a treadmill his flat-screen TV, which has a nature show on.  34.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (leaving message) Hi, it’s me. I mean, you know it’s me, I guess I'm...filling up the old mailbox...anyway, call me back. Or don’t. He hangs up. Looks at the phone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter squats in front of a fish tank with a single goldf in it. He TAPS the tank, trying to get the fish's attenti

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Here boy. Here boy. Here. INT. CARTER’'S HOUSE — DAY Carter is back on the treadmill, calling an old friend.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Mrs. Charneski, is Jeff there? Oh, he did? Okay, well, please tell him Carter said hi. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, SUBURBS Dan sits watching TV. The PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter waves at the goldfish.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Here boy. HEY. The fish is oblivious. INT. DAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT Dan sits eating popcorn, watching TV. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Hey, Dan! Carter here.  35.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (chuckles ) Carter Duryea. Listen, I’d like to get the group together tomorrow and go over some business development ideas.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Right! We'd get a great jump on the week. I‘m not talking the whole day, just the afternoon, meet at noon, I’11 order some sushi, it‘ll be fun. Great! Carter hangs up. Dan looks at the phone, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan walks up to the building on Sunday, looking angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan walks into the Sports America office. It’s empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter sits at his desk, pressing his fingers into his ey

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? From Carter’s POV, we see Steckle in double.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh, nothing, just...seeing stars. You ever do that?

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, when I was three.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What are you doing here on a Sunday?  36.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Sunday is a fun day to kick some ass.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Hey, my team’s coming in. Dan Foreman’s here, you should meet him,

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd rather not get personally involved. Didn't we decide to let him go?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, I let go of Enrique Colon instead, remember?

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, that's right. Dida little “Colon Cleansing”. Get it?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (laughs) That's good. Hey, you want to have dinner tonight?

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Wish I could, but I‘m flying to Berlin to meet with some of our satellite guys.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh. That‘s too bad.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Why? Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, just... (beat) Ah, my wife and I are having a few problems...

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Okay, gotta go. Look, you’re gonna have to riff some more people.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Riff them?  37.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Reduction in forces. Shitcan them.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Listen, I -- I think we can get pages up, so we don’t have to riff anyone yet.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Fine. But sooner or later, we all have to deal with reality. Steckle leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night. A group of salesmen are leaving the imposed Sunday meeting. Carter stands outside the door, still full of energy, saying goodbye as everyone finally leaves to go h

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Great work, thanks for coming in! Night, Morty! Night Louie! What are you guys up to? Want to go out for a beer?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: I‘d love to, but I'm a recovering alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh. Better not then. Morty?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: I'd better get home for dinner. My wife is slowly poisoning me to death, and she gets very angry if I‘m late.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (beat) Okay. No problemo. Alicia?

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: No, I have to get home and do my hair.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hey, Dan, want to grab a beer?  38.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I have to go have dinner with my family. (joking) You want to have dinner with my family?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (quickly) Sure! That would be great! Thanks a lot! Just let me get my stuff together.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey, wait -- But Carter is already off. Dan is surprised and annoyed t Carter is taking him up on his mock offer. EXT. DAN’S HOUSE, SUBURBS - NIGHT Carter’s unwashed, dented Porsche pulls up to the house. Carter has a lead foot on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Who taught you how to drive?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh, no one,

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No kidding. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Ann comes out from the kitchen as Dan and Carter come in.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Now this is a house! I mean, like a home-type house, you know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Sweetheart, this is Carter Duryea from the office.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: (fake smile) Oh. Hello. Nice to meet you.  39.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs. Foreman. Thanks so much for having me in your home. Carter HUGS Ann, who is taken by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Uhh -- You're very welcome. I hope you like baked ziti.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I love baked ziti. Baked ziti. Exactly! That is exactly what I need. Fantastic. Home cooking. Awesome. INT. DAN‘’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - NIGHT Ann and Dan are in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Is there something wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Clearly. Let’s just feed him and get him the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: He really is young. At least, a lot younger than you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Thanks for that.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I did the numbers on NYU today. Do you know how expensive that school is? Plus living expenses. Plus Jana‘s oxthodonture. Plus baby costs.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: That’s not actually a solution to a problem: “Don’t worry about it.” I think we might have to take out a second mortgage.  40.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Maybe I should go into the living room and ask my boss for a raise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is looking at framed family photos on the mantle. stares at the happy photographs, his expression is as if trying to decipher runes. Alex comes down the stairs, followed by Jana. Alex stops short.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh, hi! TI was just looking at you in these photographs, and you were, you've -~ I never actually introduced myself in the elevator. I’m Carter Duryea -~

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I know who you are. Does my Dad know you're here?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Your Dad invited me for dinner. Technically.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: Who‘s this?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: This is Dad‘s new boss.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: You can’t be Dad’s new boss. You’re too young.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: He’s also “scared shitless”.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hey. Good memory.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: Plus you’re too cute to be Dad’s boss.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Really? Thanks.  41. The PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: (yells) I‘VE GOT IT! She RUNS UPSTAIRS to answer, leaving Alex and Carter alon

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So, how's it going? Alex looks at him like he’s weird.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I‘m okay. What are you doing here, really?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Really? My wife left me, and today’s the anniversary of our first date, and I found the idea of going home to my house to be too depressing, so I sort of leeched ento your Dad and invited myself over.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: ...You‘re sort of a bizarrely honest guy, hunh?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Not really. Just with you, for some reason. Most people would probably say I’m an anal-retentive, emotionally guarded asshole. The two of them stand there a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (pause) You want to play foosball?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay. Just let me...change. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - NIGHT Ann is opening the oven.  Dan GRABS 42.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You think Alex can cope with living in New York on her own?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: T’m less worried about her coping with it than I am about you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, frankly I'd rather keep her under house arrest with a homing device on her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: So then why’d you agree to it without even talking to me? And why is your teenage boss here? And why de I feel so nauseous -- I hardiy had any morning sickness the first two times! I’m sick of it!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, calm down...let me get that -- THE HOT CASSEROLE DISH with his BARE HANDS --

dialogues.speaker: OWW
dialogues.text: He DROPS THE CASSEROLE, SHATTERING IT on the floor, splas tomato sauce on his pants. Ann just looks at him. Then she leans over to be sick in sink. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, GARAGE - NIGHT Alex is kicking Carter’s ass at FOOSBALL.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m just not that into tennis anymore, and what I’m really not into is being “the tennis jock,” you know? It’s like people don’t even invite me to parties because they think I’m in training. Also there's this rumor going around that I’m a lesbian.  43.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That sucks. I mean -- not being a lesbian, but --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not. (she smashes the ball) It would be one thing if I was going to go pro and make a ton of money, but I'm not at that level. I've played girls who are that level, and I’m not. Not that I'd want to be, really. Their lives have peaked by the time they’re like twenty-one. Carter retrieves the ball.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder if my life has peaked at 26. If it’s all downhill from here.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It probably is.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, probably. INT. DAN'’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Dan is at the door, paying a pizza delivery guy-

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Thanks. Keep the change. He closes the door with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (calls upstairs) DINNER’S READY.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: (from upstairs) I’M ON AN IMPORTANT CALL.

dialogues.speaker: DAN 7
dialogues.text: Your what? Dan puts down the pizzas, picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Mr. Foreman. Who is this, and how old are you? (pause) Alright, Will, I just wanted to say that if you ever give my daughter an alcoholic beverage or a joint, I will hunt you down and neuter you.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Dan hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: DINNER‘S READY. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, GARAGE - NIGHT Dan comes into the rec room. Sees Carter and Alex RALLYIN

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: There you are. You kids ready to come inside for dinner? Dan pauses, realizing he’s just called his boss a “kid”, his face. Alex and Carter look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family tableau. Everyone talking and eating at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Mmm. Great pizza. Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: It's from a wonderful little Italian restaurant called Dominoes.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: So are you really Dad’s boss? woot  45.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (swallows, glances at Dan) We're more -- colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (takes another slice) That’s not true. He’s the boss man. I'm the wing man.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: Are you married? You’re wearing a wedding ring.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sort of. Yes. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: So you're like...prematurely old.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Jana, would you pass the pizza?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I've got it. Carter REACHES FOR THE PIZZA at the same time as Jana, KNOCKING OVER A SODA. It SPILLS ONTO DAN‘S LAP.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That’s okay. Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Let me -- Carter tries to WIPE DAN'S LAP with his napkin.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Carter, only my wife is allowed to touch me there. Now excuse me. I have to change my pants. Again. Dan leaves the dining room. Carter smiles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (to Carter) Good job.  46.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is leaving the house, waving goodbye. Dan and Ann in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Bye, thank you so much, that was a great dinner! ‘Terrific pepperoni.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: You’re very welcome.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Goodbye. Go home. Dan shuts the door. EXT. DAN‘S HOUSE, SUBURBS - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (to the shut door) Thanks again. Carter turns, goes back to his car. Behind him, ALEX IS WATCHING HIM from the window. He glan back over his shoulder, and she DUCKS BEHIND THE DRAPE. INT. DAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT Alex looks a little puzzled with herself. Shé looks again as... EXT. DAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT Carter pulls out jerkily from the house. INT. CARTER’S HOUSE - NIGHT Carter stands in his empty living room. He tips a table l gently, balancing it until it falls off the table.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex moves into her dorm. Dan unloads her stuff out of hi station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of movers help Carter move into his new apartmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan carries a box past a POSTER OF A CANNABIS LEAF on ano student's door. He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex walks Dan out to his car. The two of them HUG.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Here’s some pepper spray. Dan hands her some pepper spray on a chain.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Thanks, that's sweet.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh, and I’ve installed surveillance devices throughout the dorm so I can tell if you're doing anything bad,

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Be careful. Dan turns his face away, hiding his emotion, and quickly into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann and Dan walk into a bank MORTGAGE LOAN office.  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Ann are in the BANK LOAN OFFICE, filling out form for a second mortgage.

dialogues.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sign here, here, and here, and you’ve got your second mortgage. Dan looks at Ann. She smiles at him, a bit ruefully. Dan SIGNS. INT. DIVORCE LAWYER’S OFFICE - DAY Carter SIGNS papers. Carter is sitting in a LAWYER’S OFFICE, filling out forms his divorce.

dialogues.speaker: DIVORCE LAWYER
dialogues.text: Sign there, there...and there. And it's official... Carter FINISHES SIGNING.

dialogues.speaker: DIVORCE LAWYER
dialogues.text: You're divorced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is in Dan’s office.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Alright, two things. First, Steckle wants to organize a company basketball league. I’m captain of the sales team. You’re power forward. Second, I heard you're taking the Rums of Jamaica guys to a Knicks game on Wednesday night. You should have run that by me.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Run it by you? They‘re my clients.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, they’re GlobeCom clients. So we're taking them to the Globecom luxury suite.  49.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: These aren’t luxury suite kind of guys.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Dan, everyone is a luxury suite kind of guy. The suite’s being used on Wednesday -- Teddy K's hosting Bill Clinton, Jay-Z and Kofi Annan -- so we'll take them to a concert on Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: A concert?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: The thing is, we need to get them to up their buy for this year by eighteen pages. We have to start kicking some ass here, or I have to let some people go.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why do you say “let them go?” They don’t want to go. Why don’t you just say “fire them?”

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Because it sounds better.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not to the person getting fired it doesn’t. Carter looks at Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights on the marquee read TONIGHT: LEGALLY DEDD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-stocked corporate luxury suite, high above the con floor. Dan, Carter, Morty, Louie, and a couple of other sales people shmooze their guests from Rums of Jamaica as HARDCORE HIP-HOP PLAYS BENEATH THEM. A waitress in hip-ho gear serves drinks. CORWIN, mid-fifties, black, from Philadelphia, not Jamaic is the head ad buyer for Rums of Jamaica.  50.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Apparently, he was shot twelve times, and pronounced “legally dead”, hence the name.

dialogues.speaker: CORWIN
dialogues.text: Someone should tell him it’s spelled D-e-a-d.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They're afraid to.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: He has a number one song out right now. He's a protege of Fifty Cent.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why don’t they call him “Nickel?”

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CORWIN
dialogues.text: (laughs) In twenty years, your jokes haven’t improved.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Anyone want another rum and coke? Corwin?

dialogues.speaker: CORWIN
dialogues.text: Nope, I’m okay. But I am glad it’s all Jamaican rum.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh, this is Petey from K-JAM sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: PETEY
dialogues.text: I’m excited to talk to you about the possibility of a cross— promotion where if you buy a certain amount of Jamaican rum, you get a discount on running shoes.

dialogues.speaker: CORWIN
dialogues.text: Un-hunh...sounds like a great fit. Get a lot of drunk people running around. Hey, Dan, you want to go get some air? .  51.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sure. I’1l be back in a bit, Carter.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No problem. But don’t be too long, we got chimichangas on the way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Corwin walk on the street outside MSG.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sorry about this concert. They wouldn‘t let me just get normal seats for the Knicks game.

dialogues.speaker: CORWIN
dialogues.text: That's okay. Dan, I’ve been instructed not to advertise in Sports America any more.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (shocked) What?

dialogues.speaker: CORWIN
dialogues.text: We were bought out last year by a company called Continental Brands. Apparently, the company that bought us and the company that bought you guys are having a feud over wireless communications in Europe.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Wireless communications? What the hell does that have to do with our business?

dialogues.speaker: CORWIN
dialogues.text: Nothing. But we have this corporate policy now. I just found out about it, or I wouldn’t have yanked your chain by coming here tonight. (sighs) I'm sorry, Dan.  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Carter sit in a bar. Carter drinks beer. Dan drin scotch on the rocks. The drink.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We'll get those ad pages back. We'll just have to work a little harder to fill ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You don‘t get it. Steckle gave me a bottom line. We had to increase pages this quarter.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ..-Dan, I have to...I have to fire Louie and Morty.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do. We’ve got Alicia, Pete, and Harry on the Ford account. So Morty is a logical choice. And the new woman at Pepsi thinks Louie’s a sexist, guess why? He called her sugartits.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That idiot. Look, you can't fire those guys. These are my guys. They‘ve been with me for eight years -- I hired them at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I know. That’s why they have big, bloated salaries, that are not commensurate with what they bring in. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (pause) I've been here twenty-three years. My salary’s higher than theirs. Why don’t you just fire me?  53.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (angry) You want me to fire you Dan? Because I could. (heated) You have a family that loves you. You have a new kid on the way. I look at you sometimes, and it’s like... (pause) You have people who need you. You really want to put them in jeopardy for Morty and Louie? Dan looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan comes up the stairs, the alcohol apparent in his plod walk. Dan looks in at Jana’s room. His younger daughter sleeps peacefully. INT. DAN’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Late at night. Dan sits on his bed. Ann reaches up and touches him on the shoulder. Then he gets in beside Ann. She pulls him closer. He puts his hand on her belly. Ann closes her eyes. Dan's eyes stay open. INT. CARTER’S (DAN’S OLD) OFFICE - MORNING Carter is sleeping on his couch. Dan comes into the offic

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What are you, living here now?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What? What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Seven AM. Look, I’ve been thinking all night. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN (cont'd) And...if it has to be done...I should be the one to do it. INT. DAN’S NEW OFFICE - DAY Morty and Louie sit on Dan’s couch as Dan closes the blin

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Guys, I feel...really terrible about what I’m about to say, but...I’m afraid you‘re both being...let go.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: Being let go? What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It means...you’re fired. Believe me, if I had any choice in the matter...I just thought you should hear it from me, because I’m the one who hired you.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, are you getting fired too?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: ...-No. This...this isn’t my decision.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: Oh, so...it’s not your decision so you’re not to blame.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe this. You were -- you were like a brother to me. I would have stepped in front of a bus for you, you piece of shit. You know, you've become a real corporate asshole.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Louie --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIE
dialogues.text: I tell you what, if you see my friend Dan, tell him I was looking for him.  55.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Louie! Louie leaves. Dan looks shocked,

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Dan...what the hell am I going to tell my wife? I mean...she already wears the pants. Now she’s gonna wear the tie and jacket too.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Morty...I‘m sorry. Morty starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: I know this must have been hard for you. You were a good boss, Dan. I mean it. You always treated everyone with respect. And...well I appreciate it. They shake hands. Dan avoids his eyes. Morty leaves, Dan stands at the interior window. Tries to open the blinds. Can’t bring himself to. INT. CARTER‘’S (DAN’S OLD) OFFICE - DAY Carter is sitting on an exercise bike, peddling. Dan come in, hands Carter something.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: My 360 self-evaluation.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ++-You’ve rated yourself "Does not meet expectations.”

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Dan turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morty leaves the office, carrying a bedraggled houseplant  56. Colleagues shake his hand, hug him goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, SOHO STREET
dialogues.text: Carter walks down the street in Soho, checking out stores He sees Alex sitting at a cafe alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter comes over to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, hey! Nothing, just reading. I'm going to NYU now.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Awesome, you did it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: How about you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I rented an apartment. In Tribeca.

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: That‘’s awesome. (pause) Do you drink coffee?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, usually I just hook up to an Iv. EXT. CAFE TABLE — DAY (LATER) (WO EMPTY ESPRESSO CUPS sit next to the FULL ONE Carter i nursing. Carter is sitting with Alex at the cafe table, his leg bouncing nervously.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You sure can pound back the caffeine. Is that why your leg is shaking like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it is.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Your wedding ring’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. I am officially the first guy from my high-school class to get a divorce.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That's okay. If I look at it honestly, it’s been coming since... pretty much our second date. So umm..-how’s school?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Pretty good! (pause, less upbeat) Pretty good. I mean, it’s sort of hard to get to know people, coming in as a transfer. Everybody has already joined their clique and they’re not sure if they can admit one more. My creative writing classes are cool, though.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Creative writing, hunh?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess I've always been interested in stories. Escaping into someone else’s life. Because mine seemed pretty boring. I’m cursed with a functional family. Of course writing isn’t exactly practical, so I’m thinking of getting a double major in business.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh, man, don’t do that. Stick with writing.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You know, sometimes you seem sort of bummed out with your career or something, which is weird because you‘re so successful. 57.  58.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, I‘m not bummed out. It’s pretty much what I have in life, you know, my career. That and a dented Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well your family must be really proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (shrugs) My mom is, maybe, I don‘t know. She was sort of a hippy, so she’s not so into the corporate stuff. And my dad left home when I was four, so...I don’t know the guy. His parents had money, but he was this “artist”, in quotes, he was kind of a druggy, he was in this cult for a while-- hey, let’s get out of here, you want to maybe...go for a walk or something? Now that you know my entire life story?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sure, but there’s not much left to talk about. She smiles at him. He smiles, enjoying being kidded.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: .--Right. EXT. SOHO STREET -— DAY Alex and Carter walk down the street, talking nonstop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Carter walk down the street in Chinatown, past a fish market. They try to avoid the fish guts on the pavement. Carter is making Alex laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Carter come out of an Italian restaurant in Litt Italy. Alex kisses him, stopping him in his tracks.  59.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Right. Carter looks a little stunned.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Umm, you want to see my dorm room, maybe? Carter laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Look, don't get the wrong idea, it’s not like I uh...have guys up to my dorm room often. Or ever, actually... Carter takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: «.+.Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex leads Carter down the hall towards her room. Music blares out from various rooms as they go past.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I_am having a major college flashback.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Come on, old man. (opens a door) My roommate's out tonight.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh. I was...really looking forward to meeting her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's...only mildly chemically imbalanced,  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A college dorm room, half of which is Alex’s, half of whi is decorated primarily in black.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Ta-daa!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wow. This is awesome.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's okay. Alex takes off her scarf by a “GLOBECOM” banner which has been graffitied to read ‘GLOBECOM SUCKS.”

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Umm...SO..-

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So...yeah...I heard this...this rumor that alcohol impairs your judgement -- She starts UNBUTTONING CARTER'S SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hold on -- wait -~

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (stops) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Umm...I wish you weren‘t so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Actually, you are.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Thank you. Attempting to set the mood, Alex light some incense -- Pu on some music -- Turns on a lamp, drapes a tie-dyed shirt over it -- MELLOW LIGHT fills the room.  él.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (gently) Well I...I think everything's perfect now...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Then why are you still talking? They kiss. Alex starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I was just thinking how my dad said he put surveillance devices all over the building.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah...that‘s very funny... He glances up at the ceiling as she PULLS HIM ONTO THE BE cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan WATCHING SOMETHING. Widen out -- He is drinking coffe watching as around him there is PANDEMONIUM. Moving men a all over, packing up people’s offices.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (to moving man) Where to now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You‘re all going to the 29th floor.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I hear there's great air- conditioning on that floor. INT. HALL BY DAN’S OFFICE - DAY Carter comes down the hall, sees Dan, and halts for a sec in fear (he has just slept with Dan’s daughter), then wav to him, overcompensating.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (almost shouts) Hi, Dan! How was your commute? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER (cont'd) Boy, can you believe they’re moving our offices again? Hey, our first hoops league game is gonna be against the 51st floor, corporate VP‘s -- which is now apparently gonna be this floor!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What? Me? Nothing. Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You’re acting jumpy. You switch from Mocha to crack?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You are really, really, paranoid, you know that?! Crack. Ha-ha! Carter turns a corner, flattens himself against the wall, EXHALES. MUSIC RISES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter picks Alex up for a date in his Porsche. The Porsche has finally been fixed. Alex steps out of the dorm to meet him in a LONG, SEXY DR Carter looks smitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Alex play tennis. Alex is drinking a soda whil hitting with Carter.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You know, that’s completely demoralizing. Alex laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sorry.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann and Dan are constructing a crib in Alex’s room. Dan i getting frustrated, trying to jam a spindle into a socket

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Den‘t force it. Don‘t force it. Dan forces it, and the bottom of the crib FALLS with a CR

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (looks at her) Don‘t say it. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - NIGHT Ann writes CHECKS for various BILLS, while in the backgro Dan leaves a message for Alex.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hi there, Alex, haven't talked to you in a few days, give us a call. (hangs up, presses redial) ...Okay, guess you have your cellphone off. Give us a call. (to Ann) Should I try again?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe the first twenty times were a fluke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter slaps down a CREDIT CARD for a fancy lunch with Al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan puts down his credit card, buying a cart full of BULK ITEMS at Target with Ann. INT. CARTER’S 2ND NEW OFFICE - DAY Carter closes his blinds. Carter fires a member of the sales team.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: (stunned) «+eI’m fired?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Then another.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: But I’ve worked here for five years? Carter reaches over and grabs some tissues, and hands the to... Sammy, his eager assistant. Sammy, who has been fired as well, is crying. He blows hi nose and shakes Carter's hand.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: It’s been an honor. Carter pats Sammy on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chairs and desks pile up in the hall, as moving men break down the empty office spaces caused by layoffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter runs in place by his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alicia pauses, seeing Carter running in place through his window. INT. CARTER’S 2ND NEW OFFICE - DAY Carter locks over, realizes he’s being watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow falls outside the building.  65. EXT. CENTRAL PARK — DAY Snow blankets the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BALLS BOUNCING. Night. AN INDOOR BASKETBALL COURT. First game of the company league. The Sports America ad sales team is in gray jerseys with SALES RATS on them. The corporate VP team, which includes Steckle, is in slick GLOBECOM TROTTERS jerseys. Dan is sliding a bulky knee brace over his leg.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Jeez, you gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'll be fine. What's that guy doing here? He's one of the moving men. Dan nods to a 6'6” guy who’s on Steckle‘s team. The movin man DUNKS.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I guess Steckle recruited him for the corporate VP team.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Well that's fair. (locks up at basket) Wonder if I can still dunk.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You could dunk?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can‘t you? You're only 26.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Heads up! Carter FLINCHES as Steckle pretends to whip a ball at him Carter chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: (to Carter) Word on the street is that Teddy K’s on the prowl. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STECKLE (cont'd) Soon as he gets back from his ‘round the world balloon trip he’s gonna go munch on Continental Brands.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Great. Maybe they’ll advertise in our magazines again. Carter flinches as Steckle focuses on Dan like a shark.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, who are you?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Mark, this is Dan Foreman. Dan just closed the Toys R Us deal.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Carter’s being modest, he did most of the work.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: That’s beautiful, maybe you two should get a room. Dan’s face gets red.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: You pussies ready to be schooled? Carter tries to laugh it off as Steckle dribbles away. Da looks pissed. THE GAME STARTS. Steckle and Dan match up. The 6’6” moving man is a ringer. But so’s Dan. The moving man dominates inside, while Dan knocks down outside shots Steckle gets more and more pissed, as Dan takes him to school. The big man starts to double-team Dan. Dan BANGS down underneath the basket, GRABBING A REBOUND, is REJECTED by the big moving man. The VP TEAM CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: (in Dan's face) YEEAAAH! Not in my house! A look of annoyance at Steckle crosses Carter's face.  67. At the other end, Steckle passes to the big man. Dan goes double team him, and he passes back to Steckle who hits a EASY LAYUP.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Sweetness! You can’t guard me! Dan swallows his anger. Next trip upcourt, Dan gets double teamed. He makes a nea pass to Carter, who makes an open layup.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yes! Carter and Dan share a moment, pointing at each other acr the court.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (to Theo) I'll take big man. Next trip down the court, Dan guards the big guy. He is U IN HIS JOCKSTRAP, keeping within a foot of him at all tim 6'6” MOVING MAN Hey, ease up old man, don’t have a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, big man, can’t take a little D? Dan KNOCKS a pass away from him. At the other end, Dan ge the ball back on a pass, starts to SHOOT when Steckle BLOCKS/FOULS him.

dialogues.speaker: RE-JEC-TION
dialogues.text: Dan glares at Steckle. The VP team runs upcourt. Steckle STREAKS DOWN THE COURT, going up for an EASY LAYUP, when Dan RUNS UP from out of nowhere, BLOCKING THE SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not in my house. Dan sprints down to the other end, catching a pass and go for THE DUNK. Dan's team cheers.  68.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
