dialogues.text: Dunk it! DAN SKIES...ALMOST MAKING IT... BUT THE BALL CATCHES THE RIM INSTEAD, causing Dan to LOSE BALANCE. Dan COMES DOWN AWKWARDLY, SLAMMING into the court. Dan hops up quickly, his shoulder GROTESQUELY out of join

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. Everyone looks a little disgusted. Steckle stifles a laugh. EXT. DAN’S 2ND OFFICE WINDOW - DAY We see Dan’s smaller new office from OUTSIDE the building Dan is making a phone call. He comes up to the window, hi arm in a sling. On the other end of the line is Alex’s answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Hi, you've reached Alex’s cell. Please leave a message. Dan hangs up the phone. We dolly over to see CARTER standing at the window in his adjoining office. Carter is staring at the city, musing. Carter turns and sits down at his desk. INT. CARTER’S 2ND NEW OFFICE - DAY Carter's screen saver is the GlobeCom logo. He hits a button, and a picture of ALEX fills the screen. Carter sits looking at the photo, an intimate closeup.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: So what‘s her name? Carter hits a button and gets rid of the picture of Alex. Dan is at the door — he hasn’t seen it.  69.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (freaked) What? Who?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The fish.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh. It’s uh...it’s a he, and his name‘s Buddy.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Doesn‘t he want a friend?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: He had a friend, but...he ate him. How’s your shoulder?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Keeps popping out. You mind? (Carter nods) Tell me something, when you were eighteen, did you ever return your parents’ phone calls?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh, well, they never called, but I guess I would have.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: My older daughter won’t call me back. I feel like going to NYU and kidnapping her, so I can stop worrying about her.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Well, that, that sounds like a not great idea. Anyway, Alex seems -- from the very brief time I met her - - to be pretty savvy. (in a reverie) I wouldn‘t worry about her too much. She’s a terrific, smart woman. Girl. Young lady. whatever. My point is, she can handle herself. (pause) You seem to have a really great marriage...How do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You just pick the right one to be in the foxhole with. And then... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN (cont'd) when you‘’re outside of the foxhole, you keep your dick in your pants.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wow, that'’s...poetic. Dan nods. Carter smiles. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - DAY A FOOTBALL-SHAPED CAKE with HAPPY FIFTY-~SECOND BIRTHDAY written on it is placed on the table by Ann. Ann's pregnancy is very visible now. A SURPRISE PARTY is in the works. The living room is full We see people from work -- Alicia, Theo, etc. among the crowd. Carter comes in.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hey, Theo, how’s it -- Theo mumbles hello as he blows past Carter. Carter finds himself standing by a preteen kid holding a wrapped basketball.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (with present) Hey, where do I put this? The kid points to a gifts table. Carter stands around a moment, trying to bond.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: This party's a rager, hunh? The kid nods unenthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Okay. Carter heads over to the gifts table. EXT. DAN’S HOUSE, SUBURBS - DAY Dan's Volvo station wagon drives towards the house.  71. INT. DAN’S STATION WAGON - DAY Dan drives towards the house with Jana.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: Are you still glad you decided not to have a birthday party?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yup. I’m not in the mood this year.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: Well, Mom says you could use a little fun. She says you should lighten up for the sake of your health.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: She does, does she? Looking towards his house, Dan sees a little MOVEMENT beh one of the drapes. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM —- DAY Alex pulls away from peeking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They're here! Everybody hide! EXT. DAN’S HOUSE - DAY Dan and Jana get out of the car. Dan pauses, looking towa the house.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You go ahead, I just want to put an envelope in the mailbox. Dan watches Jana go ahead into the house. Then he TAKES O HIS COAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jana comes in, excited.  72.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: Quiet -- he’s coming in ina minute! Everyone hide! Everyone hides. EXT. DAN’S HOUSE ~ DAY Dan is now TAKING OFF HIS SHIRT. He KICKS OFF HIS SHOBS. INT. DAN’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - DAY We hear the FRONT DOOR OPEN. Everyone leaps up and YELLS:

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE
dialogues.text: We see everyone's face register SHOCK. Ann DROPS THE’ CAM she was holding. REVERSE from their POV Dan is standing at the door in his UNDERPANTS, SMILING.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Wow! What a surprise! Dan MOONS the partygoers. Everypne SHRIEKS.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: DAAAD
dialogues.text: INT. DAN’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - DAY LATER. Dan, fully clothed now, drinks punch, chatting wit some friends, when Morty comes over.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Morty! Good to see you! Thanks for coming. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Not so good. Not so good. I mean, psychologically.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh. I’m sorry.  73.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: That‘s okay. Anyway, my wife got a promotion. I’m hoping she’1l raise my allowance. (pats Dan on shoulder) But this is good punch. Morty walks off. INT. CARTER'’S PORSCHE, DRIVEWAY - DAY Carter and Alex sit in Carter’s Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I better get back inside, they’re going to notice I’m missing.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just wanted to give you a gift. Carter hands her a box.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s not my birthday. She opens it. It‘s a pendant with small diamonds in it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Holy shit, are these real diamonds?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, they’re cubic zyrkonium. Yeah, they're real.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: These are too much, I can’t take them.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I feel funny, I -~

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, don’t feel --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s sweet. Very sweet.  74.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh. Good, thanks. They kiss. Then they both quickly look over at the house where the party is going on.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Alex, I've really been thinking, and...you’re the kind of person who's good to be in a foxhole with.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: But we‘re not in a foxhole. We're in a Porsche. INT. LIVING ROOM -— DAY The party is in swing. Dan is unwrapping presents -- most shoulder braces, boxes of Ben Gay, etc, as people cheer. looks out the window. EXT. DAN’S HOUSE, SUBURBS - DAY Carter and Alex walk back to the party, holding hands for moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sees Carter and Alex holding hands. Then they break apart as they approach the house. Dan looks like he's had the wind knocked out of him. Did just see what he thought he saw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens, Carter steps in, and Dan stops t elevator.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey, I thought maybe we could have lunch today. Go over some stuff.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I'd love to, but I already have a lunch.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? With who?  75.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (beat) With Wally Hebert from Proctor and Gamble.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Den’t you want your wing man along?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Uh, not today. The elevator closes, leaving Dan there. The other elevato opens, some people step out. A beat. Dan steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter hails a cab. From the building lobby, Dan is WATCH HIM. Dan hails a cab too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter goes inside a trendy restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter joins Alex at a table.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Sorry I‘m late. It’s really been a hell of a day.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That’s okay. But I have a three o'clock class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan is on the street outside the restaurant. Trying toe s hidden, Dan looks through the restaurant window. He FREEZ as he sees CARTER AND ALEX sitting inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Alex’s waiter comes over.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hey, you're wearing the necklace!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah. (makes a face) I feel like an imposter. I mean, it’s great, but --

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: An imposter? You look beautiful, doesn‘t she look beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: She does -- now we have three specials today. Avocado soup with Awapuhi oil. Calamari fritti with awapuhi. We have bluefin tuna with jalapeno, drizzled with awapuhi. We also have poached Maine lobster -

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: May I get a side of awapuhi oil with that, please? Alex laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan walks by the maitre d’. MAITRE D’ (smiles) Welcome, may I help you? Dan walks right past. At the table, the waiter is still reading the specials.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (locking up) Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (freaked) Dad?! Dan stands there, glowering.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Hi, is there going to be a third?  77.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I have just one question. Are you sleeping with him?

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go get you folks some bread. The waiter retreats.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Dan, this isn’t what it looks like.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh, really? What does it look like? Tell me. WHAT DO YOU THINK

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Well...it probably looks like some kind of...tawdry, sleazy affair, kind of thing, but --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Alex, I asked you a question. Are you sleeping with him?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say, Dad? Alex looks down at her plate.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (to Carter) Get up.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Get up. A beat. Carter gets up. Dan PUNCHES HIM IN THE EYE, sending Carter FLYING BACKWAR OVER HIS CHAIR. People in the restaurant GASP. Dan WINCES, holding his hurt shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dad! Stop! It’s not his fault!  78. The maitre d’ comes over. MAITRE D’ Sir, I don't think you ahould --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (wheels on him) You’d better back off before I drop kick you across this restaurant. The maitre d' veers away. Carter is on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oww -- Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (to Carter) You are a piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Dan, I love her.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I love her. (to Alex) I love you. Alex hides her face.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You love her? She’s my daughter!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: She‘s in college. She's a college student. I took out a frigging Second mortgage so she could go there! Three years ago I was paying orthodonture bills for her! Alex starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i i i k

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (to Alex) This guy? You had to sleep with him? : Dan turns and walks out of the restaurant. Alex gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan leaves the restaurant, followed by Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dad! Dad! Wait! I’m sorry, it’s not -- this had nothing to do with you!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He's my boss, Alex!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That’s not...I wasn't thinking of that. It just happened.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We made a deal, remember? We made a deal to always be honest with each other.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dad, I was five years old when we made that deal.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I liked you better then.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: That’s an awful -- an awful thing to say -~ wait, don’t walk away from me, let’s talk -- let’s talk about this --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why? You clearly don't need my advice about anything. Dan walks off, leaving Alex crying. MUSIC RISES.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sits down on a bench. Takes off his tie. He looks shattered. EXT. DOWNTOWN STREET — DAY Carter walks towards NYU, his eye blossoming purple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter comes in. Alex and her roommate are there. ALEX’S ROOMMATE Hey, Carter, wow, that’s some shiner.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Could we have some privacy, Maya? ALEX’S ROOMMATE Sure. Absolutely. The roommate leaves.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Have a seat. You want some ice for that?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yes, please. Alex goes to a mini-fridge.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Umm, we don't have any ice left. But here, this soda‘s cold. She hands Carter a cold soda, which he puts on his eye.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So, umm...sorry about my timing there, with uh...the L word. It just sort of slipped out. But I’ve been thinking about it a lot, and that’s how I feel.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Umm -- that’s really sweet.  81.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I know you probably think you do. But I’ve been thinking too, and I'm -- I'm doing a double major.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (nodding) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: And I’m taking anthropology classes on top of that. I've got a lot going on.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah...absolutely...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m not really ready for a big commitment. Carter tries to play it off like something positive.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yes. Absolutely. That‘s what I'm talking about. Look, when I said I loved you I didn’t mean that I wanted to...interfere with your classes, I mean...I’m not talking about marriage or anything. Yet.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Carter, I’ve had a great time, and I think you’re a really great guy, but...You’re on the rebound.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I‘m not.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It wasn’t all that long ago that your wife left you.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That was the best thing that ever happened to me.  82.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well...good. But then it’s a good thing whether you're with me or not. And I...I think we should stop seeing each other. Carter assumes the same cajoling expression he had when K left him.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Alex. Aleeex... Alex looks Carter in the eyes. She looks open, vulnerable The look freezes Carter. He drops the sell job he had bee trying to do.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I just want to tell you... (beat) I’ve enjoyed talking to you more than pretty much anyone in my entire life.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (swallows ) Thank you...Me too. Carter nods. Turns and leaves Alex's dorm room. The sound of the door opening transitions us to... INT. DAN’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Dan comes into the living room, looking exhausted. Jana comes down from the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: Dad?! Where have you been? Your cell phone was off.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why? What is it? (beat) Where’s mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Jana park Dan’s Volvo.  83. Dan RUNS out, ahead of Jana, SLAMMING the car door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan comes in, finds Ann lying peacefully in a hospital be

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I'm fine. The baby’s fine. I hada little scare. There was some bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: A uterine tear. It sounds bad, but it's okay. I just need some rest. Dan controls himself.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. I’m just glad you’re okay. He wipes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I just...I don't know what the hell I would do if anything ever happened to you. I think I would pack it in.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Well, I’m afraid you're gonna be stuck with me for a while. She kisses his hand. For the first time that day, Dan becomes calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late at night. Dan sits by Ann‘s bed as she sleeps. The door opens, and Alex comes in.  84. She looks at her mom.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Is she okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (whispers) Yeah. Sleeping. He puts his finger over his lips. Gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Alex sit in a small waiting area. Dan has a paper cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I broke up with Carter.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why? Because of me?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: No. Because of me. Anyway, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lying to you. Hiding stuff from you, Dan picks at the lid of the coffee cup.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I should tell you, Carter didn‘t seduce me. If anything, it was the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Please, I don’t need the details -- (beat) Unless, I mean, you want to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Uh, no. Not particularly.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Good.  85.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You probably think I'm disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Disgusting? Why on earth would I think that?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: «-I didn’t know you took out a second mortgage. I don’t have to go to NYU. SUNY’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Its fine.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (firm) No. You're staying at NYU... Dan gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Look, Alex, you’re a...a smart woman. You can handle yourself. And what I'm saying is...I‘m going to try, okay? To...be whatever kind of father I should now be for you. I’m not saying I can pull it off, but...I’'m gonna try and... adjust.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (touched) Dad...you don’t have to change.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah...I do. Dan pats her on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High angle shot on the city. Taxis, buses, people going b from skyscraper perspective.  86. INT. ASSISTANTS’ DESKS - DAY Three computer screens pop to "TEDDY K. IS COMING”, one a the other. A saleswoman reacts with surprise as Teddy K's jovial fac pops onto her screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving men lift out the table. They set up the room. Plug stuff in. Set up a podium. Steckle appears. Greets some of Teddy K’s staff. More and more people fill the space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a HUNDRED-FIFTY PEOPLE are JAMMED into the room, including Theo, Alicia and the remaining sales staff. TEDDY K emerges from the elevator bank, with his beautifu somewhat robotic assistant at his side. It’s hard to tell how old he is. He could be a mature-looking 40, or a youn looking 60. The crowd parts before him, staring, amazed, at the great man. Teddy is naturally charming, working the room. TEDDY K. Hil How are ya! Good to see ya! (to secretary) Nice brooch! (joking to assistant) We must be paying her too much money ! Teddy moves into the conference room, SHAKING PEOPLE’S HA GIVING HIGH-FIVES. TEDDY K. (greeting people) Hi, hi, how are you, hi. Teddy's assistant whispers in his ear as he approaches Steckle.  87. TEDDY K‘S ASSISTANT (in Teddy’s ear) Mark Steckle. TEDDY K. (smiles at Steckle) Mark Steckle! How are ya?! Steckle beams.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Hi, Teddy! TEDDY K. How ya doin?

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Very psyched! Steckle leads him through the crowd, stopping by Carter.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Oh, this is Carter Duryea. TEDDY K. Oh, yes, cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thanks! I’m with Sports America now. TEDDY K. That's the flagship. (pauses) What happened to your eye?

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, what did happen? All eyes are on Carter.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh, I...fell asleep at my computer. (mimes it) Bang. Right on the monitor. TEDDY K. Well...those things can be dangerous! Teddy laughs, which is the cue for everyone else to laugh  88. TEDDY kK. Well keep up the good work! Keep in touch! Teddy K. gives Carter the thumbs up sign, and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: (whispers to Carter) I wouldn't be surprised if he announces another takeover today. Teddy stands at a podium. He looks out at the crowd, as everyone settles in their seats. TEDDY K. Synergy. The room lights go down. Teddy is bathed in the blue glow from a rear~projected Globecom logo behind him. Carter looks over to see Dan, who comes out of the elevat He is in yesterday’s clothes, having spent the night at t hospital. TEDDY K. What exactly does it mean? Why does a business swim with it, and sink without it, in this new ocean of megabytes, streaming video, and satellites? Dan makes his way into the crowd. TEDDY K. There are vast differences between us. On a person to person level, on a national level, on a global level. Every day, the world becomes more complex. The crowd gazes at Teddy, mesmerized. TEDDY K. And to survive in a complex world, we need complex bonds to interface with it. The audience hangs on his words. Dan watches him with narrowed eyes. TEDDY K. What we're. building here. Is it a company, or is it an economy? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEDDY K. (cont'd) Is it a new country, with no_ national boundaries, a new democracy of the consumer? A new democracy with a new electorate. Twenty-four hour music videos in Kuala Lumpur. Computers with parts manufactured in Japan, Greenland, Idaho and India. A soft- drink ad going out simultaneously to seven continents? The Dalai Llama eating Krispity Krunch while uploading prayers onto the net? (pauses) In this room. In this room, I see this. Teddy K. Holds up his hands, FINGERS EXTENDED. TEDDY K. What we're trying to get to is this. 89. Wiggles them. Teddy K, INTERLACES HIS FINGERS, mimicking the GLOBECOM CORPORATE LOGO. TEDDY K. (smiles) This is unbreakable. This is inevitable. Woman‘’s World magazine. Why not a Woman’s World channel? Across the world. Computers. Why not a weekly computers section in Sports America magazine? Someone in the audience LAUGHS. It’s Dan. All heads turn towards him. He looks a little surprised at himself.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me. Excuse me. TEDDY K. (puzzled) Yes? There is murmuring in crowd.  90.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I‘m sorry. My uh...My name’s Dan Foreman. I...I work for Sports America...and...I’m not sure I understand what you're talking about. Carter looks at Dan, shocked. Dan proceeds, tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What I mean is, what do computers have to do with sports? Are you literally saying there should be a section in the magazine about computers? Who’s going to want to read that? Steckle shoots Dan a look of DEEP HATRED.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: And I'm not sure I understand how the way the world is changing is actually going to change how we do business. I mean, we still are selling a product which someone hopefully needs, right? We're still just human beings, with other human beings as customers. Dan picks up steam.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: And I can't see how this company is like its own country. I mean, just because we sell all different kinds of things, that doesn’t mean we should operate by our own laws, does it? Besides which, countries, at least democratic ones, have some obligations to their citizens, don't they? So how doe layoffs and bottom-line thinking fit into that? There is a long pause. TEDDY K. .».-Dan Foreman. Teddy nods gravely.  gl. TEDDY K. +..Sports America...you ask some excellent questions. (nods) Some excellent, excellent questions. (mulling it over) I’m glad you asked them. (pause) And I‘m leaving it to you... (gazes at the crowd sternly) «+.to all of you, to answer them. And now, unfortunately... (to his assistant) Absolutely. Teddy K. LEAVES THE ROOM, followed by his assistant. There is a pause. Everyone is silent. Then Steckle starts APPLAUDING TEDDY kK.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH
dialogues.text: Everyone else in the room JOINS HIM in applauding.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: TEDDY Kit! Dan walks out through the back of the crowd, who are all facing away from him, towards the departing Teddy K. INT. DAN‘S OFFICE - DAY Dan sits behind his desk. Carter comes in.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Oh my God, Dan. Steckle comes in.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Good, you’re both in here. (points at Carter) You I‘11 deal with in a second. (to Dan) You. Have you lost your frigging mind?  92.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Well, he...he said they were excellent questions.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Dan -~

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Okay, you think this is funny. You think it’s funny to disrespect a great man. Do you know who you were talking to just now? Teddy K!

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY K, GODAMMIT
dialogues.text: (pause) Look, we‘ve been carrying your fat, bloated salary for way too long. I want you out of this building within the next ten minutes. Now I’m gonna go to my office and smoke a nice cuban cigar, and try to forget you ever existed. (to Carter) In my office. Now. Steckle turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Mark...Don‘t fire him.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: He busts his ass, Mark...and...

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: (aggressive) And?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Nothing. Dan looks down, embarrassed and defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...if you fire him... (pause) You have to fire me too. Dan looks at Carter, surprised.  93.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: ---I’m sorry. Let me get something straight. You’re throwing yourself in with him? With this useless, over the hill loser? Think here, think what you're doing, because if you're not careful, you're gonna end up like him.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I guess...I guess...that would be okay.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: (beat) Alright. Then you’re fired too, you little shit.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: »+.That’s too bad, because...you're going to lose a huge client Dan and I were working on. It was going to save the year for us. Without it, Magazine’s pretty deep in the red.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What client is that? Pause. Carter glances at Dan. Dan looks at Steckle.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: +..You think we’re going to tell you? Steckle stares at Dan.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: ...You're bluffing.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don‘t bluff...I’m not that good a salesman.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: (beat) Okay, well I don't give a crap.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I think Teddy K. will. See, I’m gonna call him, and tell him you drove his most profitable magazine, his flagship, into the ground. And he’1l listen to me. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER (cont'd) (beat) He likes what I did with cell phones. Steckle looks from Carter to Dan. It's a standoff.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: You have 24 hours. Or you're both gone. Steckle leaves.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (beat) Any ideas? Dan thinks...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: «--One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Los Angeles. Dan and Carter get out of their rental car. Carter looks nervous. Dan smiles at him reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Carter walk towards the Kalb Automotive building.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You got all your research? {Carter nods) Alright. Follow my lead. He pats Carter on the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan hands a copy of SPORTS AMERICA to Morton Kalb.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Thought I’d bring you this in person again.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: Thanks. How are your daughters?  95.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They‘re great, thanks. And your grandkids?

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: They’re fine. My son-in-law has my oldest, Ralphie, enrolled ina computer camp, whatever that is. Carter approaches, laughing a little too loud. Kalb looks him as if noticing him for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'd like to introduce my boss, Carter Duryea.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: Your boss? He looks more like your nephew.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Well I’ve...been learning a lot from Dan.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: What happened to your eye?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That's one of the things he’s learned from me. An uncomfortable pause. Carter tries to laugh this off.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: Are you saying you punched him in the eye? Why?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We don’t really have to get into this.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: Please, I'm...rather curious.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (to Carter) Why did I hit you? Carter gives Dan a look. What the hell is Dan thinking?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (pauses, then shrugs) +.-He called me a dinosaur. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN (cont'd) Said I was out of date, and I'd better step in line. Dan looks at Carter. Carter’s eyes widen a touch. Kalb looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: So you slugged him?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It was a fair fight. {to Carter) Right? Carter picks up the ball.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Right. (taking out a folder) Mr. Kalb, you have a truly impressive business. I've been looking inte all the details, new franchise openings, market awareness, customer demographics --

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, you got into a fistfight because he called you a dinosaur?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know what happened. I just snapped. There’s only so much a man can put up with.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: Hunh. And...if you’re his boss, why didn’t you fire him?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (pause) He’s my best salesman. Now I’ve been looking at a cross-promotion we could do with Krispity-Krunch --

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) Carter, that’s okay. Mr. Kalb, I don’t want to go into facts and figures right now. You know them all anyway. Let me just ask you, what's your hesitation about advertising in the magazine?  97. Kalb watches the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: ..-My hesitation is that our advertising budget is already overextended. My son-in-law spent a lot of money on cable and on- line, and, frankly, we’re not getting the bang for the buck that we hoped for. He wants to plow more money into it, but...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: ++ But? Kalb looks from Carter to Dan.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: But he is such an asshole. Kalb’s anger spills out.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: I built this business, and I know more about running it than he ever “~ will. And I know that when I make a mistake, it doesn’t pay to retrench. I’m going to restructure our whole advertising plan. Starting with a major buy in your magazine.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That’s great news, Mr. Kalb! Thank you,

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Thank you so much! : Dan and Kalb shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: (to Carter) i Oh, and...I don’t give a shit about 5 Krispity Krunch. Let's just stick to the magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kalb walks Dan towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: KALB
dialogues.text: om (to Dan) So you really slugged him? i i  98.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yup. (snaps his fingers) Carter. Carter follows him out. EXT. BRIDGE, CORPORATE CAMPUS -— DAY Dan and Carter arrive at the office.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That was awesome! You were amazing! I mean, that was actually...fun!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (laughs) What Kalb really needed was to see an old fart who beat the crap out of a kid half his age. And you know what the best thing is? It’s the right thing for him to do. It’s gonna improve his business.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (stops) +-.You actually...you actually believe in this stuff, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (stops) Course I do. Why the hell else would I do it? Dan walks off down the bridge, doing a little dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Carter get off the elevator, still on a high. Ali sees them.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Dan, where have you been?!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We were in Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: We made a huge sale.  99.

dialogues.speaker: ALICIA
dialogues.text: Congratulations. So did Teddy k. He sold the company! To Calcor Communications!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: What? That can’t be! carter and Dan stand there, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Dan come in.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Mark! What happened? I thought you said Teddy K was going to buy another company!

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: That‘s what they told me, but ~- he sold us...I’m out.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wait, you’re out?

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. They’re reorganizing the whole place. (to Carter) You‘re out too. Carter looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: (to Dan) I think you’re in.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I‘m in what?

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: Your old job.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: My old job? Running the department?

dialogues.speaker: STECKLE
dialogues.text: That’s the rumor. (MORE)
STECKLE (cont'd) (he sits back, shattered) The whole thing seems so arbitrary. I feel used.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (pause) Yeah. Kinda tough to know you’re replaceable, hunh? He looks at both of them.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I‘m sorry you lost your jobs. MUSIC RISES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter sits on the street outside his apartment. He thinks. INT. DAN’S FIRST OFFICE - DAY Dan stands in his old office. The walls are empty. He has boxes cf his stuff piled in the middle of the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks towards the camera in his business suit.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. DAN’S FIRST OFFICE - DAY Dan puts all his old memorabilia, pictures, etc. back up the shelves and walls, taking posession of his office aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks closer to the camera as the music CRESCENDOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator BINGS, and Carter steps through the doors in the office.  101. He is dressed in sweats and jeans, looking like a kid for first time in the movie. He walks down the hall, looking around, looking a little lost. INT. DAN’S OFFICE - DAY Dan is back in his old office. He stands as Carter comes

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hi, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Carter. Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Nice office.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Thanks. Have a seat. Carter sits.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: So. How have you been the last month?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’ve been good, thanks. It’s been...pretty strange not having to get up and go into work in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well that’s what I wanted to talk to you about. (pause) I want to offer you a job. We definitely...had our moments. But I think you’re a good manager, and a good salesman, and I'd like you to come here and be my second in command.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (surprised) Dan...I really appreciate that, more than you know. And if I knew this was what I wanted to do, there’s no one I could learn more from than you. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER (cont'd) But I’m not sure what I want to do for a living. I’m not sure I want to work at a big place. I thought I did. I thought I had everything mapped out. But...I’m not really sure what I want to do with my life. I just know I want it to mean something to me, like this means something to you.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: oh.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Do you think I’m being stupid?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (pause) »..No, I don’t. I think that sounds right. Carter nods. He settles back. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: So how's...the family?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Ann's good. Baby’s coming Tuesday after next Tuesday. Caesarian.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Wow. That’s amazing.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It sure is. (pause) And the girls...the girls are both good.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I'm glad. Please...give them all my best. Carter gets up.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Sc what are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: I’ve saved up a bit of money, I’m going to travel.  103.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That'll be fun. Carter stands there for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Umm. ..Dan...thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: «+-For what?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: For...I guess for showing me a few things. No one ever took the time to umm...give me a hard time before. Or to teach me anything...actually worth learning. See, I never really had a... Carter takes a breath. He scowls a bit, FIGHTING BACK THE EMOTION which has snuc on him. Dan looks down.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: ---Sorry. You know what I’m saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I do.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: .. Alright.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Listen, Carter. I want to tell you something. You’re gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know it. You’re a good man. Carter stands there. It’s the first time he’s ever heard this. Carter goes over to Dan and HUGS him. Dan awkwardly pats Carter on the back. Then he HUGS Carte  They release the hug. Carter rubs his eye.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Don’t be a stranger. They shake hands.
Carter steps out if the elevator and sees Morty waiting t get on among a group of office workers.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hey, Morty! You're back!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Yeah! Back in the saddle! Look at you, you’re -- you look like a delivery guy. (turns) Hey, do you know Dan’s daughter Alex? As some people move through Carter sees Alex approaching. She's carrying her tennis gear.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: (shocked) Oh -~ hi, yeah -- what are you -- what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (shocked) Oh -- I’m just...surprising my dad, seeing if he wants to play tennis...

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (oblivious) Alex is a fantastic tennis player. She was a junior champ, right?

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Oh, really, you...you play tennis, hunh?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (smiles) +.-Yeah. So, umm...how’s it going?  105.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Good, I’m actually uh...leaving town. Think I might try and teach, or...open an awapuhi store. I don't know. You...doing good?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m...just...working on some short stories...

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: That’s...that'’s great. Morty looks from one to the other.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Well, I got a raise! Dan got mea raise, which is a good thing, because my wife just got laid off. Timing’s everything in life, right? Another elevator door opens. People get in.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (getting in elevator) Take care, Carter!

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, you too, Morty. Nice to...nice to see both of you again.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was really good to see you, Carter. Alex gets in the elevator. As the doors close, she lifts hand in a goodbye to Carter. Carter turns and walks away from the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And PUSH IN towards the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Jana are sitting in the waiting room. Dan comes out, dressed in hospital blues. He looks exhausted.  106. Jana and Alex hurry over to him.

dialogues.speaker: JANA
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: ++-Well. I am delighted to say... (he smiles) ++-You have a baby sister. Dan grins. Jana hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Are you happy Dad?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m psyched. Alex and Dan smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter runs in place. At first, it is framed to look as if Carter is jogging on treadmill in front of his TV again. A cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: Hello? Hey, Dan! Oh my God! That’s great! Got a name yet? (beat) That's fantastic. What? (pause) No, that's because I'm jogging. Carter jogs away from the camera, revealing he is on a be

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: No, I'm outside. I’m actually jogging...outside. Carter jogs off down the beach. His conversation continue as music rises. THE END.
